GAD’S HILL PLACE
HIGHAM BY ROCHESTER, KENT.

body.p: Assuming that your domestic anxieties will be over Unidentified by Saturday the 14th July, will you come down here on that day and arrange to stay over the Monday, so that we may see something of the country?These dates did not suit Dolby; see To Dolby, 1 July 1866. I have asked Mr Arthur ChappellSamuel Arthur Chappell (1834-1904), youngest son of Samuel Chappell, of Chappell & Co., music publishers, and a member of the firm that organised CD’s public readings. See To Chappell, 26 June 1866. for the same time, and have told him (both by this same post), that I am writing to you.
